title: Observation, reflection and containment: A psychoanalytic approach to work with parents and children under five.

references.title: A Theory of Thinking.
references.raw: Bion, W.R. (1962) A Theory of Thinking.  International Journal of Psychoanalysis, 43, pts 4-5, p. 306-310.  Republished in “Second Thoughts” (1967)  London: Heinemann Bradley, E. & Emanuel, L. (Eds) (2008)  What can the matter be?  London: Karnac.

references.title: Child and Adolescent Psychotherapy: A Systematic Review of psychoanalytic approaches.
references.raw: Kennedy, E.   (2004)  Child and Adolescent Psychotherapy: A Systematic Review of psychoanalytic approaches.  London: North Central London SHA.

references.title: Comment [AL6]: Page numbers? Deleted: 26 Winnicott,
references.raw: Comment [AL6]: Page numbers? Deleted:     26 Winnicott, D.W.  (1971)  Playing and Reality.  London: Tavistock.

references.title: Effects of post-natal depression on infant development.
references.raw: Murray, L.  (1988)  Effects of post-natal depression on infant development.  In K.Kumar & I.Brockington (Eds) Motherhood and Mental Illness, Vol 2.  London: Wright.

references.title: Esther Bick’s Legacy of Infant Observation at the Tavistock – some reflections 60 years on.
references.raw: Rustin, M. (2009)  Esther Bick’s Legacy of Infant Observation at the Tavistock – some reflections 60 years on.  International Journal of Infant Observation, Vol. 12, No 1. p.29-41 Stern, D.  (1985) The Interpersonal World of the Infant.  New York: Basic Books.

references.title: Fathers in parent-infant psychotherapy.
references.raw: Barrows, P. (1999)  Fathers in parent-infant psychotherapy.  Infant Mental Health Journal, 20(3 p.333-345.

references.title: Notes on Infant Observation in psychoanalytic training.
references.raw: Bick, E.  (1964)  Notes on Infant Observation in psychoanalytic training.  International Journal of Psychoanalysis, 45, p.558-566.

references.raw: Klein, M. (1959)  Our Adult World and its Roots in Infancy, Human Relations 12, reprinted in “Envy and Gratitude and Other Works, 1946-1965”, London: Hogarth Kennedy, E. & Midgley, N. (2007)  Process and Outcome Research in Child, Adolescent and Parent-Infant Psychotherapy: A thematic review.  London: NHS London.

references.raw: Pozzi, M.  (2003)  Psychic Hooks and Bolts: Psychoanalytic work with children under five and their families.  London: Karnac.

references.title: The experience of the skin in early object relations.
references.raw: Bick, E.  (1968)  The experience of the skin in early object relations.  International Journal of Psychoanalysis, 49.  p.484-486.

abstract:
The contemporary relevance of psychoanalysis is being increasingly questioned; Off the Couch challenges this view, demonstrating that psychoanalytic thinking and its applications are both innovative and relevant, in particular to the management and treatment of more disturbed and difficult to engage patient groups. Chapters address:\ud
\ud
\ud
clinical applications in diverse settings across the age range \ud
the relevance of psychoanalytic thinking to the practice of CBT, psychosomatics and general psychiatry \ud
the contribution of psychoanalytic thinking to mental health policy and the politics of conflict and mediation. \ud
\ud
This book suggests that psychoanalysis has a vital position within the public health sector and discusses how it can be better utilised in the treatment of a range of mental health problems. It also highlights the role of empirical research in providing a robust evidence base.\ud
\ud
Off the Couch will be essential reading for those practicing in the field of mental health and will also be useful for anyone involved in the development of mental health and public policies. It will ensure that practitioners and supervisors have a clear insight into how psychoanalysis can be applied in general healthcare.\ud
\u
